page.title: 02Newquay's Tourism-Historical
page.content:
Newquay is the largest tourist resort on the north Cornish coast,and attracts large numbers of visitors which boost the population of the area by 163% to over 70,000.
Newquay developed as a tourist resort from two original villages whose total population was just 489.
Trenance valley is sheltered from the high winds and salt sprays which affect most of Newquay and it was soon realised that the sunny,sheltered and rolling nature of the valley provided a pleasant contrast to the bracing air and cliff scenery of the coast.In 1906 the upper part of the valley was laid out for public gardens and the natural track widened for vehicles.With the coming of the railways Newquay's tourist business soon flourished.
